results.title: PDGFR Signaling Mediates Hyperproliferation and Fibrotic Responses of Subsynovial Connective Tissue Cells in Idiopathic Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
results.text_hl: In contrast @GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMP-activated protein kinase@@@ (@GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMPK@@@) activation, which can be induced with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_AICA_ribonucleotide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C031143 @@@AICAR@@@ inhibited proliferation, @GENE_TGFB1 @GENE_7040 @@@TGF-beta@@@ expression, and altered cell morphology in @<m>DISEASE_Connective_Tissue_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003240 @@@SSCT@@@ cells.

citations.NLM: Saito Y, Chikenji T, Ozasa Y, Fujimiya M, Yamashita T, Gingery A, Iba K. PDGFR Signaling Mediates Hyperproliferation and Fibrotic Responses of Subsynovial Connective Tissue Cells in Idiopathic Carpal Tunnel Syndrome Sci Rep. 2017 Nov 23;7(1):16192. PMID: 29170419
